Text: Job Survey and Matching Darren and Donna were left off of Bobs email can you set up times with them Forwarded by Kathryn BussellHOUECT on PM Bob M NRON PM To Robert CT George D NRON Randall L CT Michael CT Victor CT Edward CT Katherine L CT Rita CT Pat NRON cc Kathryn CT Subject Job Survey and Matching Just to give you a head up Katherine will be getting with each of you next week to work on a new job survey and matching process for HR to do a salary comparison This should be like the one done last year we only have till Thursday of next week to get this finished thanks bob

RE FW ENA Contracts Going to AEP Cc Jpst Darren Farmer has the remainding transportation agreements in use He cant get new agreements until Monday at the earliest so he requested that they stay active He will have to beg the pipes to set up new agreements retro to Original Message From Campos Sylvia Sent Friday June PM To Bussell l Kathryn Subject Re FW ENA Contracts Going to AEP Kathryn Thank you for killing deals and however deals and still have a status of validated Please advise when these deals will be killed Thanks for all your help Sylvia x From Kathryn nronXgate on AM To Sylvia A CT Cyndie Balfour NRON cc Subject FW ENA Contracts Going to AEP Please look at the last page last hunk of contracts to find the transport deals in question They are on the latest contracts staying with ENA list Original Message From Hall Bob M Sent Tuesday May AM To Bussell l Kathryn Subject FW ENA Contracts Going to AEP please get with george smith and find out what he is doing with these deal Original Message From Weissman George Sent Thursday May PM To Hall Bob M Cc Dudley Cheryl Braband Sandi Melissa NRON Walker Robert Subject RE ENA Contracts Going to AEP Bob Walker I neglected to activate the activeinactive filter in the document I sent Sandi earlier today so you were seeing contracts that no longer have active HPL deals I have revised the document to show only those ENA IM Texas contracts that have active deals after June Sorry for the confusion On the CES matter I left Bob Hall a message relating to who recognizes the benefit of the CES contracts during June Enron or AEP I suspect his answer will be AEP and if so youll need to put the appropriate backtoback paper in place I asked him to call either you Sandi or me George File Dudleyrevxls Forwarded by George Sandi Bob will be sending a comprehensive memo to all George Prior Attachment Deleted PM Forwarded by George WeissmanHOUECT on AM From Bob M nronXgate on PM To George CT cc Sandi M CT Kathryn hedge for the Tuffco contract George Forwarded by George WeissmanHOUECT on PM OLE Object Picture Device Independent Bitmap Enron North America Corp From George Weissman PM To Sandi M CT cc Robert CT FW Dominion Producers Cc Shemin we EES have been using December nd as our split date We understood to do so per separate conversations with Steve Van Hooser and Christy Finelli If it is possible to terminate the pools retroactively we would much prefer using Decnd as opposed to Dec rd as Chris mentions below Original Message From Germany Chris Sent Thursday March PM To McMichael Jr Ed Shemin Proctor Email Mark Ellenberg Email Cc Concannon Ruth Parks Joe Garza Maria Mann Kay Bussell l Kathryn Hewitt Jess P Loretta Cross Email Jeff Benton Email Melanie Gray Email Price Wade R Dhont Margaret Subject FW Dominion Producers Recommendation for ENA Pools st choice Terminate pools and producer contracts on no cash flow and everything is prepetition nd choice Terminate pools and producer contracts on and deal with one months cash flow rd choice Terminate pools as soon as possible to eliminate the administrative effort involved Ive been trying to determine the EES imbalances on Dominion and Im not having much luck Dominion gave me the ENA balances over the phone When I called back a day later to get the EES balances I was told to submit a written request to Bill Saviers Dominions in house counsel I have not done that I would prefer that Dominion provide us a written document stating what the pool balances are as of and Based on the pool balances below I would recommend terminating the ENA pools effective assuming the following Producer payments for Oct and Nov have not been made and go into the prepetition bucket ENA owes Dominion gas which is also prepetition The producers will be able to reallocate their gas for December forward to another marketers pool Items to consider If we terminate the pools on or later ENA will need to sell the imbalance gas and pay the producers Dominion will need to provide ENA a method to do this if the pools are terminated I would recommend paying the producers after we collect the money for selling the imbalance gas AND after we pay Dominion any gatheringtransporting charges associated with those balances The volumes are small so ENA will not see much economic benefit from this process Also the administrative effort involved is VERY VERY HIGH due to the small volumes per producer Dominion will prefer to cancel the pools with a or positive imbalance On ENA will still have a negative cumulative imbalance Most of the producers have not been paid for Oct or Nov activity I assume that since those dollars go into a prepetition bucket that we should not terminate any producer contracts before Per Vickie Coen at Dominion ENA Pool Balances as of Gath North Tran North Gath South Tran South Cumulative Dominion IF Prices Mar Feb Jan Dec Nov Oct Sep

Credit file Cc a list of all currently flowing deals with counterparties that Credit has deemed not worthy of entering into physical trades with The file is currently sorted to show the most recent trades up front and is filtered to only show No Trades physical If you care to see other counterparty designations refilter on the physical terms column

weekly credit file Cc the weekly credit file sorted and filtered as usual There are about new No Physical Trade deals out there since last week A lot are with PGE they have made another prepayment and we are allowed to trade EOL only with them again
